item.title: TonRunner
item.description:
TonRunner

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.

item.title: No title
First openwater swim of the year.
item.description:
First openwater swim of the year.

Chilly but lots of fun

item.title: Running in God's country
item.description:
Running in God's country

Some more photos from my running in the Yorkshire Dales

For many, it'll be their first time. These are the 10 things which every London Marathon virgin will want to know. Greenwich Park and Blackheath are lovely settings for the start. You won't really enjoy them, you'll be in the queue for the toilet.

item.title: Brighton Marathon 2016
item.description:
Brighton Marathon 2016

Had a good day at the office, having had a good first 8 weeks to the training my original intention was to go for a 3:05 her and gain good for age for London next year; you may remember my half marathon time suggested I was on the right track, unfortunately since then I have had a back injury that has plagued training and meant that in the last 6 weeks I have done no speed work and my longest run has been just under 12 miles, prior to that I had done one 20 mile run. Needless to say I was not going into the run with too many expectations.

item.title: Running is good for your mental health - and I'm here to prove it
item.description:
Running is good for your mental health - and I'm here to prove it

The new Mental Health Ambassador programme, launched on Tuesday by England Athletics and supported by the charity Mind, has recruited 128 people - of whom I am one - from 91 affiliated athletics clubs across the country, to do a bit of running and talking.

item.title: All the gear...: 'How obsession with kit eclipsed my love of running'
item.description:
All the gear...: 'How obsession with kit eclipsed my love of running'

It's 2012 and I'm at Wimbledon chatting with Serena Williams. We're recording an interview for BBC radio and she's telling me about her new wristband which measures movement, heart rate, calories, even sleep quality. The technology is staggering.

item.title: 3 Best Exercises for Lower Abs
item.description:
3 Best Exercises for Lower Abs

The 'number one' best exercise for the lower abs is reverse curl ups. This very same exercise helps recruit the pelvic floor muscles which act as a contractile sling across the base of the abdominal cavity. The pelvic floor muscles are often forcibly weakened by the bearing down effects of excessive sit up exercises. In later life, this can lead to incontinence.
